title: Hero air steward threw passengers out of burning plane when they stopped to get luggage
text:
Tatyana Kasatkina has detailed how she threw passengers out of the plane (Picture: East2west News)

A hero member of cabin crew on a plane that crashed and burst into flames has given an emotional account of how she saved people’s lives.

Tatyana Kasatkina, 34, was on duty when 41 people died in the crash at Moscow’s Sheremetyevo airport when the plane turned into a fireball.

Footage shows the plane bouncing along the runway as it comes in to land during bad weather as flames start pouring out of the back before it came to a stop.

Giving a dramatic account of events during an inquiry into the crash, Tatyana said: ‘When the plane stopped, the evacuation immediately began.

‘The fire was visible. Everyone was shouting that we were on fire, But there was no fire inside the cabin at this moment.

Passengers were criticised for stopping to get their luggage (Picture: East2west News)

Four out of the five members of cabin crew survived – the fifth one died trying to rescue people (Picture: East2west News)

‘I kicked the door out with my leg and pushed out the passengers so as not to slow the evacuation. Just to hurry them up I grabbed each of them by the collar from the back.

Advertisement

‘It was all so quick. The smoke was already black. The last people were crawling to get out. Everyone had jumped from their seats and moved forwards, although the plane was still moving at a good speed.

‘I saw the first woman calling somebody on her phone and saying – “we are on fire, we are falling down”.

‘Lightning hit us, there was a flash followed by popping, A bright light flash. We took off and got into a cloud and it was hailing.

‘There was such a noise outside (as hail hit the plane). At that moment it was a popping, mainly on the ….left side…

Tatyana Kasatkina, 34, was on duty when 41 people died in the crash at Moscow’s Sheremetyevo airport (Picture: East2west News)

‘Everyone was looking at me looked at me. There was popping and a flash, like an electric flash.

‘The flight deck informed us that we were returning to our home airport.’

However, the plane’s internal communications system went down and she could not hear the pilot as he told her to prepare for an emergency landing.

Advertisement

Advertisement

She said: ‘I could not understand who was calling, a pilot or a steward. That was it, we were flying back home.

‘We took off at 6.03 pm approximately. Some 10 minutes later we got into this cloud.

‘I saw the fire at the back, all were shouting – we are on fire! – but there was no fire inside the cabin.’

The crew reportedly did not dump any fuel, which is common for flights that have to land soon after take-off (Picture: EPA)

The Interfax agency reported that the plane, a Russian-made Superjet-100, had just taken off (Picture: AFP)

The Aeroflot aircraft burst into flames at Sheremetyevo airport after hitting the runway (Picture: AP)

Her colleague, flight attendant Maxim Moiseev died trying to rescue passengers.

The plane’s seating plan revealed that all people in the business class and some in the front of the economy class survived.

However, there was criticism at the time of the crash that people slowed the evacuation down by stopping for luggage.

Survivor Dmitry Khlebnikov said: ‘I thank God – and the stewardesses who saved me.

‘They were always with us, helping people to climb the slide and get out of the cabin full of smoke. It was dark and incredibly hot inside.’

Passenger Dmitry Kharinin said: ‘At first everything was good, the crew did well, they worked well during the first seconds. All special services arrived very quickly but people around were panicking.

‘Thank God, the crew did well and quickly took the people out’.

Unconfirmed reports say at least five people have been injured (Picture: east2west)

Video on Russian news channel Rossiya-24 showed the plane, a Sukhoi SSJ-100 regional jet, landing with large flames engulfing the rear section (Picture: east2west)

The Sukhoi Superjet 100 aircraft of Aeroflot Airlines is covered in fire retardant foam (Picture: AP)

One survivor praised the plane’s attendants for helping save him and others (Picture: AP)

The plane melted in the heat (Picture: AP)

No fuel had been dumped prior to the landing, it has been revealed (Picture: AP)
